file_content.text: I'll gather my personal effects and stow them on your ship at once, Lieutenant.
Lieutenant, sir. Is there something else I can do for you?
Consider this your official invitation to Havoc Squad, Sergeant Dorne.
I want you on my team.
Go pack your gear. You're with me now.
You're transferring to Havoc.
The general says you're in Havoc now, so you're in Havoc now.
Garza wants you in my squad.
A transfer? Into Havoc Squad?
Lieutenant, this... this is the greatest honor of my career. I'm speechless.
Membership in Havoc Squad is the highest achievement in all of the Republic Armed Forces, Sergeant. Congratulations.
Don't get too excited, Sergeant. It's not as impressive as it's made out to be.
Sergeant Dorne, reporting for duty, Lieutenant! I'll prepare my Regulation 6 Personnel Transfer documents at once!
You've more than earned this, Sergeant.
Congratulations.
Assemble your kit and embark on my ship, double-time.
Move out, Sergeant.
Quit wasting time with regulations and get your gear packed.
Forget the damn documents.
I'll gather my personal effects and meet you onboard your ship, Lieutenant. Thank you.
The holocommunicator in the next room is active and ready for you to contact General Garza, Lieutenant.
General Garza attempted to contact you a few moments ago. I took the liberty of briefing her on your mission status.
Much appreciated.
Did she ask you about anything else?
Is that all you talked about?
The general also asked for a summary of my service record, which I provided.
My "mission status" is supposed to be classified--you aren't supposed to know about it.
So much for secrecy.
General Garza expressed no concern as I'm sure she's familiar with the temporary clearance authorized by Security Code MR-7-C.
The general requested that you contact her before departing Taris. The holocom in the next room has been prepared for your use.
I'll contact her right away.
Very well.
Did she tell you why she wanted to talk to me?
Do you know what she wants?
The general did not inform me of her intentions.
The faster I get off this mudball, the better.
Let's get this over with, then.
Congratulations once again, Lieutenant.
Welcome back, Lieutenant. Congratulations on the success of your mission.
I'm just doing my job, Sergeant.
Thank you.
I couldn't have pulled off this mission without you, Sergeant.
You're the reason I succeeded.
I was only following orders, Lieutenant.
It was no sweat.
Your success is consistent with your unit's reputation and operational history--all highly impressive.
Good luck locating Needles, Lieutenant.
Lab results confirmed Thorus's account: Needles has almost completed a weaponized strain of rakghoul disease.
However, the data makes no mention of Needles's "friends" in the ruins of the transport system.
Do you have any idea who these "friends" might be?
So who are they?
Needles probably has another whole outpost loaded with Imps out there.
I'll bet they're Imperial.
Unlikely. Thorus would've been aware of another Imperial team operating so close by.
I can't say I'm looking forward to meeting these people.
Friends of Needles--scary.
You said it. Dorant's as creepy as they come.
Available intelligence doesn't show any populations in the ruins of the transport system, but scans of the area have been cursory at best.
Rakghouls infest the area, making scouting by foot inordinately difficult. However, one traversable route has been located.
I'll scout the area myself.
Then that's where I'm going.
Any geographical information you can bring back would be very helpful, Lieutenant.
What are you getting at?
If the route we've located is the only one available, then the odds are good that you'll find Needles somewhere in the area.
Great, I get to wander aimlessly through rakghoul-infested sewage.
That's all you have for me?
I apologize for the lack of intelligence, Lieutenant.
This ruined transport station is our only lead to Needles's location. I would encourage you to stock up on supplies and munitions before entering the area. Good luck.
You spared a war criminal, Lieutenant. That man murdered hundreds of people, and you simply let him walk out of the Imperials' base.
I didn't want to let Thorus go free either, but it was the only way.
I'm sorry, I had no choice.
It was the fastest way. Not the only way.
I'll take your opinion under advisement, Sergeant.
Your objection is noted.
I'd appreciate it.
It wasn't your call.
Rank is irrelevant. Rules and regulations apply to all of us, sir.
Let's move on, shall we?
Good work with Thorus, Lieutenant. War criminals do not deserve the opportunity to strike deals.
We need to return these men to base for medical treatment and debriefing. Proceed without us, Lieutenant.
Lieutenant! Status report--are you injured?
Negative, no injuries here.
Good. There's much to do.
These guys didn't have a chance against me.
Are you kidding?
I might be hurt, Sergeant--you'd better come rescue and search me.
[Flirt] I could use a checkup.
Flirtation and other non-mission-critical communications over priority holochannels are strictly forbidden by procedural guidelines, sir.
I'm pretty sure that was a "no," Lieutenant.
I guess we know what happened to the other patrols.
Let's talk about my attackers.
Affirmative, sir. There can be no doubt.
Your attackers were scavengers. Threat assessment reports classify them as a non-combatant group.
That classification is clearly inaccurate. I'll notify Command.
I don't see why these scavengers would strike at Republic personnel.
Why attack us?
It's puzzling. Our forces are superior in numbers, training and equipment--the scavengers must know that.
I need to know where these scavengers come from, their numbers and armaments.
Give me everything you know.
Unknown, sir. Local intelligence felt they weren't worthy of investigation.
Is there some reason you neglected to mention this threat?
You should've warned me.
As I said, the scavengers were never classified as a threat. I apologize for the oversight.
Armed hostility against Republic personnel clearly justifies an immediate armed response, Lieutenant. It's your call.
We need to move against these scavengers immediately.
I say we strike back.
Do we have any leads on the scavengers' HQ?
Where are these people based?
This isn't my problem.
Don't look at me.
Understood, sir, but we won't learn more until this lead is investigated.
Orbital scan has just managed to pinpoint the location of the scavengers' compound.
I'll scramble up my team and prep them immediately. We'll effect entry to the compound once you've created an opening.
I'll see you on the other side, Sergeant.
Understood.
For freedom!
Good luck, Lieutenant. Sergeant Dorne out.
It's nice of you to let me do all of the hard work.
You're supposed to be helping.
Forward assault and reconnaissance both fall under Havoc Squad's specializations. You're the most qualified for the task.
Be careful, Lieutenant. I'll attempt to rendezvous with you inside. Dorne out.
There's only one more area left to search, Lieutenant.
More power converters. According to the logs, this patrol followed an entirely different route.
Either both patrols recovered the same engine parts from separate locations, or the converters were dropped in both areas by one group: the attackers.
I think we're on the right track, Sergeant.
Sounds reasonable to me.
This could all just be a coincidence.
Don't jump to conclusions.
The odds would be astronomical, Lieutenant. We're past that point now.
Care to tell me how this helps us?
So what?
If the converters were dropped by an enemy, we can use them to track that enemy.
A specialist MO-7 science officer could examine the converters to determine their source. We have such an officer on staff. I will notify him while you search the last coordinates.
Sounds like a plan, Sergeant.
Copy that.
Very well, Lieutenant. I'll proceed to science division at once.
It would be nice to have something more substantial to go on.
Hope I find better evidence.
I don't see the point, here.
More samples can only mean more intel.
Good luck, Lieutenant.
We need more intel, Lieutenant. Two areas remain.
Those are power converters, Lieutenant. Old ones. Any theories on how they got to that location?
I was hoping you could tell me.
Negative, Sergeant.
The people who attacked our patrols may have dropped them.
They could be a clue.
Possible. None of the other patrols logged similar discoveries.
I don't need help, Dorne.
Just let me handle this.
General Garza ordered full cooperation, sir. I will follow that order.
Power converters come from ignition systems, engine parts. It takes work to remove them.
Someone dropped those converters--either the patrol or their attackers. We need more information to determine which.
I'll search the next coordinates immediately.
Understood.
Guess I'd better find more information.
Yeah, I'd say so.
Swamp junk tells us nothing.
MIA guidelines require that all leads be investigated. Even unlikely ones.
I'll remain in contact, Lieutenant. Dorne out.
I'll be in contact if you find anything in the field, Lieutenant.
Good day to you.
My squad is prepping now, Lieutenant. We'll hit the scavengers' compound right behind you.
You have been deemed worthy of the most elite fighting unit in the entire galaxy, Sergeant Dorne. I look forward to working with you.
You needn't worry, Lieutenant--my sensors confirm that you do not require the aid of a Search-and-Rescue team.
